title: Improve getter/setter regex for react/sort-comp
body:
Before, the getter/setter regex was matching on methods named like `setFoo` and `getFoo`, which resulted in confusing warnings like:
```
error  methodFoo should be placed after setFoo  react/sort-comp
```

After this change, the regex only matches lines with whitespace in between `get` or `set` and the name of the setter.

title: Cleanup code examples
body:
Run `airbnb-base` ESLint rules set against code examples (only accidental non-educational errors are fixed).

* `'''js` -> `'''javascript` for consistency.
* Fix indentation for consistency.
* Comment out ellipses.
* `const` -> `let`.
* Add / remove semicolons.
* Add spaces.
* Add trailing commas.
* Remove  trailing or leading underscores.
* Fix arrow IIFE call (currently, it throws).

title: Trailing comma in function call after spread operator
body:
In the part [19.2](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/README.md#commas--dangling) there is a confusing comment above the last example:
```js
// good (note that a comma must not appear after a "rest" element)
createHero(
  firstName,
  lastName,
  inventorOf,
  ...heroArgs
)
```
1. This is actually a spread operator.
2. ESLint reports `Missing trailing comma` for this case.
3. It seems there are no restrictions for using trailing commas in function calls after spread operator:
```js
'use strict';

function createHero(
  firstName,
  lastName,
  inventorOf,
  ...heroArgs
) {
  console.log(heroArgs);
}

createHero(
  'firstName',
  'lastName',
  'inventorOf',
  ...['a', 'b'],
  ...['c', 'd'],
);
```
```
node --harmony_trailing_commas test.js
[ 'a', 'b', 'c', 'd' ]
```

title: new error
Confusing examples in 4.5
body:
[Chapter 4.5](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/README.md#arrays--callback-return) contains some confusing examples.

1. `map` examples have not corresponding bad examples. What bad cases they advise against?
2. `reduce` bad example is just wrong, it throws `TypeError: Cannot read property 'concat' of undefined`. `reduce` callback can't be used without `return` statement.
3. `filter` examples seem to be just a case of something like ['no-else-return'](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-else-return) ESLint rule.

title: [guide] Correct erroneous example
Update react.js
body:
According to the eslint-plugin-react docs allowMultiline has a default value to be true.

By default, braces spanning multiple lines are allowed with either setting. If you want to disallow them you can specify an additional allowMultiline property with the value false.

title: Update README.md
body: Looks like there is a typo.

title: Avoid octal number interpretation
body:
- Some JavaScript versions interpret numbers as octal if they are written with a leading zero.
- Babel interpreter throws with an `Invalid number` message.

title: JS Style Guide JSCS Links for ES5 or ES6
body:
Howdy,

Currently I am trying to implement the airbnb style guide for a project which is using ES5 and will not be upgrading to ES6 any time soon.  After looking at the ES6 style guide and the ES5 (deprecated) style guide the links provided are to the same preset.  My question is, are these presets compatible with ES5?

The preset is linked below:
https://github.com/jscs-dev/node-jscs/blob/master/presets/airbnb.json

Thank you!

labels.name: semver-minor: tighten rules to match guide

This Pull request is to fix #1240. This will enable no padding for switch statements and class declarations along with blocks.

Reference : http://eslint.org/docs/rules/padded-blocks

title: Update common function body comment
body:
- This commit provides a canonical way of describing
  that the function body contains code of some sort.
- The convention chosen was `// ...`.
- This change is persisted throughout the readme file
  where appropriate

If there is another suggestion for that common way to describe a function body, I'm totally open to updating this PR.  I could see `// ...stuff...` being used frequently enough as well, so if thats a choice please let me know.

Thanks!

title: Update 4.5 documentation for good/bad flow consistency
body:
- This commit reorganizes the bad and good examples to
  match the flow with the rest of the documentation.
- The general flow is that a bad example is provided
  followed by a good or best example.
- To match the same convention, the good examples
  are funneled to the bottom of the block so that
  users can understand the wrong approach first

body:
Take 2!

cc @ljharb

title: Is ESLint 'no-iterator' rule appropriate for 'Don't use iterators' advice?
body:
See https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#iterators--nope.

It seems the ['no-iterator'](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-iterator.html) rule has a very restricted aim. Moreover, it contains this advice which contradicts the 11.1 part:
> You should use ECMAScript 6 iterators and generators instead.

title: weird issue with `react/jsx-no-bind`
body:
this is my `.eslintrc`:
```
{
    "root": true,
    "parser": "babel-eslint",
    "extends": "airbnb",
    "ecmaFeatures": {
        "classes": true,
        "jsx": true
    },
    "plugins": [
      "react"
    ],
    "rules": {
      "react/display-name": 1,
      "react/jsx-filename-extension":0,
      "react/jsx-no-bind": 2,
      "semi": [ 2, "never" ],
      "import/no-extraneous-dependencies": 0,
      "no-use-before-define": 0,
      "no-underscore-dangle": 0,
      "import/prefer-default-export": 0,
    }
}
```

For some reason, the rule `react/jsx-no-bind` doesn't work for me while extending `airbnb`. If I remove the `"extends": "airbnb",`, I get lint errors, but when I extend, lint ignores any setting I might have and doesn't show errors/warning at all.

title: Cannot read property 'name' of undefined at no-array-index-key.js:146:25 - And eslint-config-airbnb@14.0.0  invalid
body: Running our good old install command: ``` ( export PKG=eslint-config-airbnb; npm info "$PKG@latest" peerDependencies --json | command sed 's/[\{\},]//g ; s/: /@/g' | xargs npm install --save-dev "$PKG@latest" ) ``` Today gave this: ``` ├─┬ eslint@3.13.1 invalid │ ├── file-entry-cache@2.0.0 │ ├── natural-compare@1.4.0 │ ├── strip-bom@3.0.0 │ └── strip-json-comments@2.0.1 ├─┬ eslint-config-airbnb@14.0.0 invalid │ └── eslint-config-airbnb-base@11.0.1 ├── eslint-plugin-import@2.2.0 ├── eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y@3.0.2 └── eslint-plugin-react@6.9.0 ``` I don't see what is invalid about that since those versions are all listed on npm. Running my lint script gives an error about: ``` Cannot read property 'name' of undefined TypeError: Cannot read property 'name' of undefined at /Users/user/project/node_modules/eslint-plugin-react/lib/rules/no-array-index-key.js:146:25 at Array.forEach (native) at EventEmitter.CallExpression (/Users/user/project/node_modules/eslint-plugin-react/lib/rules/no-array-index-key.js:145:28) at emitOne (events.js:101:20) at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:188:7) at NodeEventGenerator.enterNode (/Users/user/project/node_modules/eslint/lib/util/node-event-generator.js:39:22) at CodePathAnalyzer.enterNode (/Users/user/project/node_modules/eslint/lib/code-path-analysis/code-path-analyzer.js:607:23) at CommentEventGenerator.enterNode (/Users/user/project/node_modules/eslint/lib/util/comment-event-generator.js:97:23) at Controller.enter (/Users/user/project/node_modules/eslint/lib/eslint.js:928:36) at Controller.__execute (/Users/user/project/node_modules/estraverse/estraverse.js:397:31) ``` Has anyone else seen this?

title: Rule 'no-empty-label' was removed
body:
I'm having issues running eslint with `"extends": "airbnb"`.  I used the [instructions on the npm page](https://www.npmjs.com/package/eslint-config-airbnb), and ran the command:

```
(
  export PKG=eslint-config-airbnb;
  npm info "$PKG@latest" peerDependencies --json | command sed 's/[\{\},]//g ; s/: /@/g' | xargs npm install --save-dev "$PKG@latest"
)
```

which added the following to package.json:

```
...
devDependencies: {
    "eslint": "^3.13.1",
    "eslint-config-airbnb": "^14.0.0",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.2.0",
    "eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y": "^3.0.2",
    "eslint-plugin-react": "^6.9.0"
  }
...
```

but, when running eslint, I get an error for: 
`Rule 'no-empty-label' was removed and replaced by: no-labels `

If I remove the `"extends": "airbnb"` section from the `.eslintrc ` file, I don't get these errors. 

Did I do anything wrong?

title: Airbnb's `padded-blocks` ESLint rule definition may be incorrect
body:
In the Airbnb style guide, [section 18.8](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#whitespace--padded-blocks) states to "not pad your blocks with blank lines". To enforce this via ESLint, the `padded-blocks` rule is used in [style.js](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/style.js#L317).

Currently, `padded-blocks` is set to `['error', 'never']`. This, however, means that `switch` statements and `class` declarations are not being checked correctly (the documentation around this was a bit poor - see [this](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/7868) issue).

In order to correctly enforce this for _all_ blocks, the `padded-blocks` rule needs to be set to `['error', { blocks: 'never', classes: 'never', switches: 'never' }]`. :)
